description: In this article Joe Birch walks through his experience of creating an Android TV app. He covers a lot of good insights starting from dealing with a TV navigation and which layout items to use for the best TV experience. Be sure to check out the full code on GitHub.
title: Vineyard  —  Creating an Android TV Vine App

description: Second blog post by Pedro Vicente Gómez Sánchez about a kick ass testing development pipeline for Android.
title: World-Class Testing Development Pipeline for Android - Part 2

description: In this series Mark Allison will take a look at ways to handle requesting permissions both from a technical perspective, and in term of how to provide a smooth user experience.
title: Permissions – Part 1

description: The Android framework provides great utility classes for asynchronous processing. However, most of them queue up on a single background thread. What do you do when you need more threads?
title: Using concurrency to improve speed and performance on Android

description: Small advice series about Android Testing.
title: Testing Tricks #2: Finding UI Views

description: In this post by John Petitto you'll learn the caveats of dependency management when writing an Android Library.
title: Dependency Management for Android Libraries

description: In this post by Hamid Gharehdaghi you'll learn how a bundle works and how to pass an object to a fragment.
title: Sending objects to Fragment; Naive question: is it sent by value?!

description: The ADB Shell is a hatred beast to tame. In this series of blog post you'll learn how master it gracefully.
title: Efficiency and fun from using ADB Shell, Part 1

description: In this post by Egor Andreevici you will learn how to apply Aspect Oriented Programming (short AOP) with AspectJ. He will write a sample application that adds the tracking aspect (with Google Analytics) to an application without violation the single responsibility principle.
title: Going aspect-oriented with AspectJ and Google Analytics

description: Google Developers are introducing a new Marshmellow feature on Medium. This post will explain how to create a custom text selection actions with ACTION_PROCESS_TEXT.
title: Creating custom Text Selection actions with ACTION_PROCESS_TEXT

description: Chiu-Ki Chan shares a new approach to instantiating a special test application by subclassing the application in the androidTest folder and load it during tests via a custom test runner.
title: Mock Application in Espresso for Dependency Injection

description: Android developers are in demand, so shouldn't companies apply to you? On Hired, that's exactly how it works. Get 5+ job offers from companies like Uber, Stripe, and Facebook with 1 application. Join Hired today and get a 2k bonus when you get a job!
title: Hired - The Marketplace for Android Developer Jobs

description: Tired of configuring Jenkins? Greenhouse is a cloud-based continuous integration service for Android (and iOS) apps. Build, test and distribute your apps for every commit without any complicated configuration or setup - you'll be up and running with just a few clicks. Use the coupon code "XMAS15" and get one month for free!
title: Hassle-free Continuous Integration for Native Apps

description: You have extensive knowledge of Android and typical app projects bore you? We're building an SDK that's used by many high-profile companies and just shipped version 2 with annotation editing support. PSPDFKit powers a lot of apps and we face unique challenges. Come and help us build something great!
title: Let's build an SDK at PSPDFKit

description: A little playground for Android Espresso testing framework, especially focusing on IdlingResource approach
title: AndroidEspressoIdlingResourcePlayground

description: Relays are RxJava types which are both an Observable and an Action1. Basically it's a Subject except without the ability to call onComplete or onError.
title: RxRelay

description: ExternalResources is an Android library which allows you to use resources over the air.
title: External Resources

description: OnActivityResult annotation compiler for Android.
title: OnActivityResult

description: A simple weekly calendar.
title: WeekCalendar

description: Yet another floating search view implementation, also known as persistent search.
title: FloatingSearchView

description: Vine client for Android TV.
title: Vineyard

description: Base on some AOSP checkins, Google will likely replace Oracle's Java APIs with OpenJDK in the next version of Android.
title: Google Will Replace Oracle's Java APIs With OpenJDK

description: Ben Plowman works on iOS, Android and server at the same time, and chats about the similarities and differences on the two mobile platforms.
title: Android Dialogs: Ben Plowman

description: Timothy Jordan gets a list of great developer topics for you to check out during the holiday season. Learn about Service Worker/progressive web apps, how you can use TensorFlow in your apps to recognize objects, and more!
title: The Developer Show 008
